events.title: Gettysburg Address Delivered
events.description: President Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address at the dedication of the Soldiers' National Cemetery in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, during the American Civil War.
events.significance: The speech redefined the purpose of the war, emphasizing liberty, equality, and national unity, becoming one of the most famous speeches in American history.

events.title: Christopher Columbus Returns to Spain
events.description: Christopher Columbus returned to Spain from his first voyage to the Americas, bringing news of his discoveries in the New World.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of widespread European exploration and colonization of the Americas.

events.title: Start of the Battle of Heartbreak Ridge
events.description: During the Korean War, United Nations forces began the Battle of Heartbreak Ridge against North Korean and Chinese troops.
events.significance: A brutal battle that lasted over a month, symbolizing the intense and costly nature of the Korean conflict.

events.title: Harry Houdini Dies
events.description: Famous magician and escape artist Harry Houdini died from peritonitis caused by a ruptured appendix.
events.significance: Houdini was a pioneering figure in magic and illusion, influencing entertainment and pop culture.

events.title: Thomas Edison Born
events.description: Inventor Thomas Edison was born in Milan, Ohio, USA.
events.significance: Edison became one of the most prolific inventors in history, credited with innovations like the electric light bulb and phonograph.
